Dan is a text-based chatbot that frees your mind of having to remember things you need to do.
Outcome: displays all the tasks in tasklist
Command template: deadline (description of event) /by (deadline date)
Outcome: adds a deadline task to your task list
Command template: event (description of event) /from (start date) /to (end date)
Outcome: adds a event task to your task list
Outcome: adds a todo task to your task list
Command template: mark (index of task in list starting from 1)
Outcome: marks task as done in your task list
Command template: delete (index of task in list starting from 1)
Outcome: deletes task from your task list
Outcome: returns tasks with descriptions matching the search string
Command template: remind /within (number of days from now)
Outcome: returns tasks with dates within number of specified days from current day
* Constructs a DeadlineCommand with the specified deadline task.
* @param d the deadline task to be added to the task list
* Returns the command type for this command.
* @return CommandType.DEADLINE indicating this is a deadline command
* Executes the deadline command by adding the deadline task to the provided task list.
* The task must be of type DEADLINE.
* @param tasks the task list to add the deadline to
* @return a confirmation message indicating the deadline was added and showing
*         the current number of tasks in the list
* @throws AssertionError if the task is not of type DEADLINE
return "Got it. I've added this task: \n " + deadline + "\nNow you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.";

* @param i the index of the task to be deleted (1-based indexing)

* @return a confirmation message showing the deleted task and the updated

* @throws AssertionError if the index is not greater than 0 (after validation)

* Returns the command type for this command.
* @return CommandType.EXIT indicating this is an exit command
* Executes the exit command by returning a farewell message.
* This command does not modify the task list and is used to terminate the application.
* @param tasks the task list (not used in this command)
* @return a farewell message to be displayed when the application exits
return "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!\n";
